intro: Randia tetrandra, commonly known as the four-thread randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Randia tetrandra typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories.
